noun.description: A tough-skinned terrestrial mollusk which typically lacks a shell and secretes a film of mucus for protection. It can be a serious plant pest.
A slow, lazy person; a sluggard.
An amount of an alcoholic drink, typically liquor, that is gulped or poured.
examples: he took a slug of whiskey

noun.description: An elongated, typically rounded piece of metal.
examples: the reactor uses embedded slugs of uranium

noun.description: A line of type in Linotype printing.
A part of a URL which identifies a particular page on a website in a form readable by users.
examples: writers can edit the slug that will become an article or page URL

verb.description: Drink (something, typically alcohol) in a large draft; swig.
examples: she picked up her drink and slugged it straight back

origin: Mid 19th century: of unknown origin; compare with the verb slog.
